draft-comment.p:
This topic should be an overview for the oXygen Publishing-Template feature. It should answer to the following questions:
What is oXygen Publishing Template? Why should anyone want it? Another important use case covered by the oXygen Publishing Template is that you can use it to share a WebHelp Responsive customization with your team. Or you can develop it using oXygen standalone application and then use it in a continuous integration system to publish your documentation whenever it was changed.
Where is it available?
oXygen Publishing Template feature is available only for WebHelp Responsive transformation using DITA documents. It will be used in a future version to customize the DITA Map PDF - WYSIWYG transformation. TODO

body.p: WebHelp Publishing Template defines all the aspects related with the look and feel(layout and styles) of the WebHelp Responsive output. It represents the main method for customizing the WebHelp Responsive output allowing you to:

ul.li: add additional template resources (CSS, JS) to customize the output
change the layout of the topic or main page by customizing which components will be displayed and their position in the page.
extend the default processing by specifying one or more XSLT extension points.

body.p: A WebHelp Publishing Template represents a customization package that you can easily share with your team. Another benefit of this customization method is it allows you to easily upgrade from an older version of .
